page.title: 03HOUSING IN KEMBERTON
page.content: Kemberton has 92 houses 79 of which are owner-occupied. Kemberton Hall Farm is a 16th century house and there are the sites of at least 3 other 16th century buildings. One cottage has been converted into a bungalow and two others,which were damaged by fire in the 1940s, have been rebuilt as one dwelling. Many houses were built in the 18th or 19th century.They are nearly all detached and range from cottages to large houses such as Kemberton Hall. The Cedars and Kemberton House are substantial 18th century farmhouses, the land to which has now been sold. There is one terrace of 6 cottages built about 1810 which has been converted into 3 larger dwellings. One of these was an abattoir and another was,until recently,the village shop.
